entry.title: Re: Version management for Central purchase contract
entry.content:
That means, the configuration for central purchase contracts may not have versioning enabled in your system settings. Check your SPRO settings. Also, if no fields are marked as version-relevant, no version will be triggered even if changes are made. Go to version management config and ensure critical fields (like validity, price, supplier) are flagged.

Check in the transaction ME32K from the Version Overview button, how the status looks like. If it’s missing or disabled, versioning is likely not active.

entry.title: Smarter Crew Management in SAP Field Service Management
entry.content:
In today’s complex field service operations, managing crews efficiently is more than just grouping technicians—it's about synchronizing skills, availability, and demand to ensure seamless service delivery. With SAP Field Service Management (SAP FSM), organizations gain powerful capabilities to manage crews with clarity, flexibility, and full operational transparency.

Let’s take a closer look at how SAP FSM supports Crew Management across planning, execution, and workforce optimization.

Crew Creation & Assignment: Build Teams that Deliver Together

SAP Field Service Management enables dispatchers and planners to define and manage crews as flexible, powerful planning units. Whether your teams are fixed, rotating, or formed for specific tasks, crew creation is fast, adaptable, and built for the real world.

  • Easily group internal employees and external partners into a crew.

  • Assign a crew lead responsible for execution, reporting, or on-site coordination.

  • Add crew members permanently or for specific timeframes—ideal for project-based work or regional resource sharing.

  • Modify crew composition daily to respond to operational needs, unexpected changes, or technician availability.

  • Create crews manually or via system integrations—supporting centralized and decentralized planning models.

The result: simplified planning and execution for jobs that require multiple hands and coordinated efforts.

Planning Board Visibility: Plan Crews Like a Pro

The visual Planning Board in SAP FSM is built for high performance and ease of use—even for large organizations with hundreds of technicians.

  • Crews are clearly visible as a planning entity, distinct from individuals, allowing dispatchers to drag and drop jobs directly onto the crew.

  • When a job is assigned to a crew, all members receive it automatically, avoiding double effort and ensuring all hands are on the same page.

  • See individual and collective crew workloads, optimize travel times, and prevent overbooking with real-time insights.

This provides planners with instant clarity and full control, enabling fast decisions even in high-pressure environments.

 

 

Mobile Crew Management: Flexibility in the Field

SAP FSM brings crew management into the hands of field technicians with robust mobile capabilities that go beyond simple assignment viewing.

  • Technicians can assign crews to activities directly in the mobile app, ensuring responsiveness in the field.

  • Only eligible crews with matching assignment start dates are selectable—preventing scheduling errors.

  • A technician can handover crew leadership to another crew member on a different day—ensuring accountability stays current.

  • Entire crew-based assignments can be reassigned to a single technician, with responsibilities and support roles updating automatically.

These mobile features allow technicians to adapt quickly, manage real-life changes on the ground, and keep the workflow moving—without depending on a dispatcher to intervene.

Work Time Patterns: Respect Working Hours Without Micromanagement

Unlike older systems where crew planning meant manual juggling of calendars, SAP FSM provides work time patterns that define crew availability smartly.

  • Define working hours, shifts, and recurring patterns and assign to individuals.

  • Combine with region-specific calendars and time zones.

  • Let the system automatically calculate availability windows—reducing scheduling errors and service delays.

The system adapts to real-world complexity without overwhelming the planner, increasing efficiency while respecting work-life balance for technicians.

Absences & Reservations: Handle the Unexpected with Confidence

Crew management isn’t just about the ideal state—it’s about managing real-world variability.

Availability is calculated dynamically, taking into account individual absences, reservations, and assigned crew timeframes. This ensures only available and active members are scheduled—preventing planning errors and improving service reliability.

This proactive handling of unavailability helps maintain high service levels without burning out your team.

Why It Matters: Unlock the True Potential of Team-Based Field Work

Many organizations struggle with rigid, outdated solutions that treat field service scheduling like a puzzle of individual technicians. SAP Field Service Management takes a modern, intelligent approach, empowering service leaders to:

  • Scale operations without adding administrative overhead.

  • Boost first-time fix rates through better coordination and accountability.

  • Deliver consistent, high-quality service with the right teams on the job every time.

Whether you're dispatching for utility maintenance, medical device repairs, or industrial equipment inspections, SAP FSM ensures your crews are equipped, available, and aligned.

Ready to Take Crew Management to the Next Level?

With SAP Field Service Management, you're not just assigning jobs—you’re orchestrating service excellence. If you're looking to simplify crew operations, increase planner productivity, and improve service delivery outcomes, it's time to explore what FSM can do for your teams.

References

SAP Field Service Management Help Portal:

  • Crew Management in Master Data 
  • Crews in Planning and Dispatching 
  • Crews on Field Service Mobile

SAP Field Service Management

entry.title: Re: How to Find Cordinates of a Particular text in Smartf...
entry.content:
Yes it's possible. OTF is stored in SAPGOF format (SAP Generic Output Format). It indicates all information needed to print anything. There was some online documentation about SAPGOF some time ago (I don't know where it is now). Below are excerpts of this documentation.

The two first characters of each line represent the command and the following characters are the parameters. For instance:

MT0009700280
CP41030000F
FCCOURIER 120  00144           410300144
UL +0000000000000
CT00000000
ST0057611Hello world

MT (Move To?): 

  • The MT command sets the cursor, i.e. the current output position, to a particular position on the output page. The reference point for this is the top left hand corner of the page.
  • Parameters:
    Function              Length    Type
--------------------  --------  ----
Horizontal position   5         TWIP
Vertical position     5         TWIP
  • If a string is output at the end of the position specified by MT (see ST command), then the horizontal position describes the left margin of the character box and the vertical position describes the baseline of the character box for the first character in the string. MT does not specify the upper-left corner of the character box.

ST (Set Text?): 

  • The character set which is specified using the ST command is applied from the current output position, which, as a rule, has been determined immediately beforehand using the MT command.
  • The parameter "Length in TWIP", which is important for pixel-oriented output devices and the parameter "number of characters to be output", occur before the character set itself in the command.
  • The number of characters in the ST command sets out the length of the character set in bytes. You must always keep to this length, filling up the character set with spaces if need be.
  • In the case of two successive OTF ST commands, the starting X-position of the second character set is determined by the length of the character set (in TWIP) in the first ST command.
  • Parameters:
    Function              Length    Type
--------------------  --------  ----
Length in TWIP        5         TWIP
Number of characters  2         NUMC
Character set         variable  CHAR

TWIP: Twip - Wikipedia

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Enhancing Report Management with the power of generative AI copilot – Joule
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) enthusiasts. 

Joule is an innovative AI designed to manage your personal chats, enter prompts, and delivers responses based on your report's content. Our AI can be conveniently accessed through the floating action button with the Joule icon, which appears in the bottom-right corner of the page in reports. 

Now that you are acquainted with Joule’s capabilities, let’s delve deeper into our exploration of Artificial Intelligence in this blog post. 

Prerequisites for using Artificial Intelligence    

In this section, we will explore the essential components required for harnessing Artificial Intelligence (AI). We will rely on the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) to cover these prerequisites. For comprehensive guidance on these requirements, visit the SAP Business AI (Joule) Setup . 

Integrating AI features into the SAP PaPM Cloud SM is a breeze, thanks to a streamlined setup process that involves just five key components.  

  • SAP AI Core 
  • SAP Launchpad 
  • SAP BTP Destination 
  • Configuring SAP AI Core Destination in Settings 
  • Joule in Reporting 

SAP AI Core 

Let's begin with the process. First, we set up an SAP AI Core instance, the dynamic engine that powers our AI workflows and models. To use generative AI capabilities, choose the SAP AI Core Extended plan.

For more information on how to set up SAP AI Core service visit SAP AI Core.

SAP Launchpad 

The second one is a subscription to SAP AI Launchpad, which helps in deploying predefined SAP AI models.

Next, we deploy our predefined AI Models through the SAP AI Launchpad, a crucial step for their seamless integration into the SAP PaPM Cloud SM.  
Be aware that not all AI models are supported in the SAP PaPM SM. To see which models are supported, please visit the Supported Foundation Models.

For more information on how to set up SAP Launchpad and deploy AI models, visit SAP AI Launchpad.

SAP BTP Destination 

Then we configure the AI core and model settings within the SAP BTP destination, guaranteeing seamless connection. You can follow the template below: 

 

Attribute  

Value  

Destination Name  

Unique name of destination in current subaccount 

Type  

HTTP  

Description  

Any description for the destination name 

URL  

<AICoreServiceKey.serviceurls.AI_API_URL>/v2/inference  

(from credentials in AI Core service key)  

Proxy Type  

Internet  

Authentication  

OAuth2ClientCredentials  

Use mTLS for Token Retrieval  

Leave this unmarked

Client ID  

<AICoreServiceKey.clientid>  

(from credentials in AI Core service key)  

Client Secret  

<AICoreServiceKey.clientsecret>  

(from credentials in AI Core service key)  

Token Service URL Type  

Dedicated  

Token Service URL  

<AICoreServiceKey.url>/oauth/token  

(from credentials in AI Core service key)  

Token Service User  

(empty)  

Token Service Password  

(empty)  

Additional Properties  

Enter the following values:  

ai-resource-group – <the Resource Group value from your AI Launchpad workspace> 

Use Default JDK Truststore option is marked.  

Please refer to the image below to see how the BTP destination should look after it is successfully created. 

For more information on how to set up the BTP destination, visit SAP BTP Destination. 

Configuring SAP AI Core Destination in Settings 

After you have created the destination, you can add it to the Settings in the SAP PaPM Standard Model together with the AI model. This will enable communication between applications running in SAP BTP and the Standard Model to utilize artificial intelligence within the application. 

You can add AI Core destination under Joule AI Settings in the Default AI Core Destination Name by typing the name of the destination or choosing it from the dropdown menu. The dropdown list will show all BTP destinations that you have created. You need to select the destination configured for Joule that has deployed AI models in the SAP Launchpad. 

If you choose a non-AI destination, an error message will appear below the Default AI Model field and Save button will be disabled. 

Now, select the AI model you want to use. When you open the drop-down menu, all configured models in SAP Launchpad will be shown. Supported models will be selectable, while unsupported ones will be grayed out and unavailable.  

For optimal experience, we suggest you to use the recommended model, but you are free to choose any model from the list of Supported Foundation Models.  

After setting up SAP AI Core destination in the Settings, you can now see it and use it in the Reports Management Screen which is the next section in this blogpost. 

Joule in Reporting 

We enhance our reports by utilizing Joule, which enables us to explore data more interactively and provides us with valuable analysis. This approach enables us to fully leverage AI technology, transforming our discoveries into actionable insights that inform our decisions. 

The advantage of Joule is its capacity to understand the context of every report. This functionality makes complex reports much more accessible and practical.  

Accessing Joule is easy, you need to click on the Floating Actin Button in the lower right corner of the screen, and Joule chat will be opened. 

Now, we can see how Joule responds to our questions. You can ask a question about some topic from the report. By simply asking Joule, we will receive an immediate response. 

Note: If you're accessing a report for the first time, you need to save it by clicking Edit and then Save in the General header section. 

You can start a new chat by clicking on the button Start new chat in top right corner of the Joule chat, the previous chat will be removed, and you will only see the new chat. To close the Joule chat you need to click on the Close Joule button, which is located next to the Start new chat button. 

Each chat session you create in Joule Chat is your personal space - completely private and visible only to you. The Joule chat is available on all pages in your report and can answer questions about topics from all pages, regardless of which page you are currently on. The chat you have started will remain available on the report screen until you initiate a new chat or refresh the screen.  

Joule enhances SAP PaPM Cloud SM by turning complex reports into clear, actionable insights through the power of AI. 

I hope you find these updates helpful! 

Stay tuned for the latest updates and insights in the next one. Thank you!

entry.title: Developing a Customized AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Part 2
entry.content:
In this Part - 2, we'll dive into using the Custom Analytical Queries APP with our newly created Custom CDS View to build an AR Aging Analysis Report.

 

Please refer Part - 1 to Understand the Custom CDS View created for the AR Aging Analysis Report:

https://community.sap.com/t5/financial-management-q-a/developing-a-customized-ar-aging-analysis-report-in-sap-s-4hana-public/qaq-p/14163727

 

Custom Analytical Queries APP:

The Custom Analytical Queries APP is like a smart tool that helps you create your own reports and analyze your business data, even if you're not a tech expert.

Imagine you're trying to build your Customer Aging Analysis Report. Instead of writing complex computer code, this app takes all the raw numbers and information (like invoices, payments, and dates) and turns them into an easy-to-understand table or grid. It hides all the difficult technical stuff, so you just focus on what you want to see.

Here's how it helps you design your report:

Pick and choose your data: The app provides all the available fields from the business transactions. For your aging report, you'd select fields like Customer Name, Invoice Number, Posting Date, Due Date, Amount Due, and Clearing Date.

Filter what you see: You can set filters to narrow down your report. For example, you might filter to see only particular customers, or invoices past their due date by more than 365 days.

Create custom calculations: You can add restricted measures (like "Total Overdue Amount for 30-60 Days").

See results instantly: You can preview your report as you build it, so you know exactly what the final output will look like.

 

Step – 1: Open the APP – Custom Analytical Queries

Click on “Create” button.

 

Enter the “Query Name”, Choose the “Data Source” – which we have created as a CDS View.

Click on “OK”.

 

Step – 2: Name the Analytical Query

In the General Tab,

Enter the “Label” for the AR Aging Analysis Analytical Query and Click on Next Tab “Field Selection”.

 

Step – 3: Field Selection for the Analytical Query

In the Field Selection Tab,

Choose the required fields from the Available Fields by selecting the “Check box” to display in the AR Aging Report.

 

Step – 4: Arrange the Selected Fields in the Analytical Query

In the Display Tab,

Select relevant Field and Choose the “Axis” - Row / Column. Once selected the Axis, the field will be automatically moved to Row / Column Tab same as Company Code, Customer etc.

Note: Arrange the fields according to the business format and also Amounts / Numerical / Calculation related fields are arranged under the Measure Structure of Column Axis.

 

Step – 5: Choose the Input Parameter Fields for the Report

For the AR Aging Analysis Report, users need to provide input parameters such as Open Items at Key Date, Customer, Company Code, GL Account, and Posting Date to generate the report based on their selections.

In the Filter Tab,

Choose the respective Field and then Select the radio button “Uset Input Values”.

Select the “Default Value” if required.

Note: Our AR Aging Analysis report runs based on the Open Items at Key Date, showing all items not cleared by that date. If you need to pre-fill any input fields, you can use the Default Value functionality in the filter section.

For Example: Below are the selected Input Parameters for our report and the “Open Items at Key Date” and “Company Code” will be defaulted at the time of report execution based on the settings in Analytical Queries.

Step – 6: Create Calculated Measure Fields (Aging Buckets) for the Report

Creating Aging Buckets is the most challenging aspect of developing the AR Aging Analysis Report. This is primarily due to the complexity of applying the necessary formulas. To build custom aging buckets, you'll need a foundational understanding of IF & Else conditions, similar to those used in Excel, to grasp the CASE WHEN Expression formulas utilized in SAP Analytical Queries.

 

  1. Not Yet Due (Aging Bucket - 1)

In the Display Tab,

Click on “Add” button and Choose “Add Calculated Measure” to create the Aging Bucket.

Then Enter the “Label” and Click on “OK”.

We've now added a "Not Yet Due" field to the query. This field displays the Amount in Company Code Currency for any customer open items with Overdue Days less than or equal to zero.

The above logic has been applied in the analytical query using the CASE WHEN formula.

In the Expression Section,

Choose the “Edit” button to apply the formula.

Select the “Function” button then Choose the “Case Expression” and Click on “OK” button.

The formula applied in this “Not Yet Due” field is, if the Overdue days field is less than or equal to “0” then “Amount in Company Code Currency” should be displayed in the report or Else the value should be displayed as “0”. You can Choose the Measure fields by click on measures button or else you can type relevant measure field in the Expression editor. Once formula applied the Click on “OK”.

 

  1. 1 to 30 Days (Aging Bucket – 2)

Apply the same steps involved in Not Yet Due field, only the formula will be changed for this 1 to 30 Days Aging Bucket.

For the "1 to 30 Days" field, we've applied a specific formula:

If a Customer Open item's Overdue Days are greater than or equal to "1" AND less than or equal to "30," the Amount in Company Code Currency will be displayed. Otherwise, the value will show as "0." This formula uses an AND condition to accurately identify customer open items that are between 1 and 30 days overdue.

After applying the formula, simply click "OK."

 You can apply this formula and change the conditions according to the Aging Buckets (31 to 60 Days, 61 to 90 Days…etc).

The Sum of all the Aging Buckets from “1 to 30 Days till Above 365 Days” will be the “Total Overdue Amount”.

Once the respective fields created in the Custom Analytical Queries APP.

Click on “Save Draft” the changes will be saved. Then click on “Preview” option to validate the report values.

 

Step – 7: Preview and Validate the Created Custom Analytical Query

In the Input Parameters, The Open Items at Key Date and Company Code will automatically default the value according to the settings in Custom Analytical Queries APP and also it can be changeable at the time of report executing.

Once maintained the Input Parameters, Click on “GO”.

You can validate the output of the report in the Preview. So, the issues will be identified and resolved before publishing the Custom Analytical Query for the APP creation.

 

Step – 8: Publish the Created Custom Analytical Query for AR Aging Analysis Report

Click on “Publish” to publish the created Custom Analytical Query for the AR Aging Analysis Report APP creation.

 

View Browser APP:

For SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition key users, the View Browser app is essential for finding CDS views. This includes both SAP-released and custom CDS views.

The app provides a comprehensive list of available CDS views. You can see details like Category, View Types, Dimensions and Measures, Annotations, supported capabilities, and modelling patterns. It also offers robust search options. You can search by descriptions, application components, or even the tables used to build the CDS views.

Beyond searching, you can use the View Browser to analyze a CDS view's data fields. The application displays all CDS views and their underlying artifacts in tables. By default, views are organized by name, but you can also filter column values using a dropdown.

While you can't change SAP-created CDS views in the View Browser, the Custom Analytical Query app allows you to create, save, modify, and publish your own CDS views to catalogs.

 

Step – 1: Create the Application for Created Custom Analytical Query

Open the “View Browser” APP.

Search the Created AR Aging Analysis Analytical Query in the Search Bar and then Click on the respective Analytical Query to Create the Application.

You can check the Fields, and CDS View involved in this Analytical Query.

Click on “Create Application”.

Choose the “Language”

Enter the “Title” and “Subtitle” for the Report and this will be the Application Name.

Click on “OK”.

Finally, the Application is created for the developed AR Aging Analysis Report.

 

Custom Catalog Extensions APP:

This app lets you assign your apps to specific business catalogs. After creating a new app, you must link it to the necessary catalogs. To use your new app, you'll need to assign a business role that includes that Catalog.

 

Step – 1: Open the APP – Custom Catalog Extensions

Select the Created Application to assign it to the respective Business Catalog.

 

Step – 2: Assign Business Catalog to the Application

Click on “ADD”.

 

Choose the respective “Business Catalog” and then Click on “OK”.

Select the Business Catalog and then Click on “Publish” button.

Confirm by choosing the “OK” to publish.

Finally, the Created Application is assigned with the Business Catalog and published for the business usage.

 

Step – 3: Display the APP - AR Aging Analysis – Report

Once the APP is assigned with the Business Catalog, you can search the created APP in the search bar to display it for the reporting purpose.

 

References / Acknowledgements:

I'd like to extend my sincere thanks to the various SAP documentation, community blogs, and helpful tutorials that guided me through the intricacies of Key User Extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

I highly recommend them for anyone looking to dive deeper into SAP S/4HANA Cloud extensibility:

  1. https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/customer-aging-and-supplier-aging-reports-at-the-line-item-level-using/ba-p/13563839
  2. https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/creating-custom-cds-views-and-analytical-query-a-step-by-step-guide/ba-p/13508914
  3. https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/e30de6eae4d24d70b65996ac8ff88848.html?locale=en-US&version=2502.500

 

Conclusion:

Developing a customized Customer AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, as demonstrated, truly highlights the power and flexibility of "Key User Extensibility." While standard solutions offer a solid foundation, the ability to adapt and build tailored reports is crucial for meeting unique business requirements and ensuring user satisfaction.

By leveraging apps like Custom CDS Views, Custom Analytical Queries, the View Browser, and Custom Catalog Extensions, key users can effectively design and deploy robust financial reports without extensive technical coding. This empowers organizations to gain deeper insights into their financial data, streamline processes, and make more informed decisions regarding accounts receivable management.

This project was a testament to how SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition enables businesses to go beyond standard functionalities, proving that with the right tools and a clear understanding of business needs, powerful custom solutions are well within reach.

Thank You!

entry.title: Opportunity Marketplace Facet Filter
entry.content:
Dear Talent Experts,

We are currently in the process of implementing the Opportunity Marketplace and are seeking clarification regarding the configuration of facet filters.

According to the https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-opportunity-marketplace/implementing-opportunity-marketplace/search-criteria-for-opportunity-marketplace?q=filter it is possible to use custom fields and job roles as filters for assignments. However, the documentation does not provide specific instructions on how to implement these additional filters.

At present, only the default filters—Type, Location, Work Mode, and Participation—are available in the Broaden Your Experience section. We would greatly appreciate any insights or best practices on how to enable and configure additional filters, such as custom fields or job roles.

Thank you in advance for your support and expertise!

Best regards
Johanna

Period(s) to Run (as also attached in SS you can check):

- Periods YTD
- Period Range

 

What I would like to achieve is the following:

Is the selected period value from the pipeline execution stored anywhere in the database (perhaps in a pipeline context or runtime table)?
so, we could access that value inside our stored procedure, maybe through a variable to filter the data accordingly?

Any guidance, pointers to documentation, or examples would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,

Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: [CALM] Restricting Import in Build phase
entry.content:
SAP Cloud ALM currently does not permit the restriction of Feature actions based on the phase of the parent Project.

SAP Help Portal page Status flow for Features section Actions states that status based restrictions of actions only apply based on the statuses of the Feature itself. The Project phase/status cannot be used to restrict actions in a Feature. The Deploying Features documentation also specifies that deployment is a permitted activity if the Feature has one of the statuses "In Implementation", "In Testing", or "Ready for Production".

Development currently have no plans to change this functionality (as of 2025-07-29) in the SAP Roadmap Explorer page for SAP Cloud ALM. If you wish to influence the future development of SAP Cloud ALM and provide direction to our Developers in relation to this topic, please use the options outlined in this KBA: 3391676 - SAP Continuous Influence for SAP Cloud ALM

An idea entry already exists in the Customer Influence campaign which discusses this topic: CALM for Implementation - Requirement to Deployment Strict Workflow with compliance. Vote on the idea to show support for this functionality proposal. If the idea gains enough support, our Dev team may take it forward to the planning stages.

You need to understand that Stock Room Management is LE-WM. Stock Room Management is not a new functionality, it is not a new module, it not new software. It is just a fancy, confusing name for basic features of LE-WM in S/4HANA context. Thus, if you use LE-WM in S/4HANA, you are already using Stock Room Management. There is no switching!

entry.title: 🧵CL_SALV_TABLE — Seleção com ROW_COLUMN não mantém referência na impressão
entry.content:
💡 Dica útil

💥Ocorreu após a migração ECC / S4 💥

Hoje me deparei com um comportamento curioso usando SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>ROW_COLUMN ) no CL_SALV_TABLE. Ao tentar imprimir as linhas selecionadas com:

lo_selections = o_alv->get_selections( ).
lt_rows = lo_selections->get_selected_rows( ).


"Notei que a referência da seleção se perdia após o usuário clicar em 'Imprimir' e, depois, executar alguma rotina que dependia da seleção de linhas. As linhas selecionadas não eram preservadas como esperado. Testei trocar para:"

SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>MULTIPLE )

🟢 Troquei para MULTIPLE e resolveu! As linhas selecionadas passaram a ser capturadas certinho na impressão. Fica a dica: se você precisa garantir que a seleção funcione como esperado, esse modo é muito mais confiável.
⚠️ Vale lembrar que a CL_SALV_TABLE não tem suporte direto pra capturar colunas selecionadas — diferente da CL_GUI_ALV_GRID, que dá bem mais controle nesse ponto. Então, se você precisa dessa precisão, talvez seja hora de considerar a migração.
Alguém aí já passou por isso? Encontrou alguma solução criativa ou outro caminho pra contornar? Compartilha aí!

entry.title: Re: Loans Management - Inter-company loans
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes, you can handle this kind of intercompany loan scenario in SAP, though it does require some setup:

🔹 Basic Approach:

  • In Company A, post the outgoing bank transaction as a loan asset (e.g., to a G/L account like “Intercompany Loans Receivable”).

  • In Company B, post the incoming transaction as a loan liability (e.g., “Intercompany Loans Payable”).

You’ll need to manually assign and match repayments unless you're using automation.

🔹 Suggested Process:

  1. Set up loan accounts in both company codes.

  2. Use Document Type & Posting Keys for proper classification.

  3. Track repayments using reference fields or loan IDs.

  4. Use Recurring Entries or Contract Management if the loan has scheduled payments.

🔹 Want automation?

If you’re looking for structured management contracts, interest calculation, and tracking, you might consider intercompany loan software , especially if managing multiple subsidiaries and group-level treasury operations.

Let me know what version of SAP you’re on—features can vary a bit between ECC and S/4HANA.
https://dnetsoft.com/treasury-management-software-dynamics

entry.title: 🧵CL_SALV_TABLE — Lost selection reference when printing using ROW_COLUMN
entry.content:
“Problem occurred after ECC/S4 migration.

Today I ran into a strange behavior while using SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>ROW_COLUMN ) in CL_SALV_TABLE. When trying to print selected rows using:

 

lo_selections = o_alv->get_selections( ).

lt_rows = lo_selections->get_selected_rows( ).

🚨 I noticed that the selection reference was lost — selected columns weren’t preserved as expected. I switched to:

 

SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>MULTIPLE )

 

🟢 That did the trick! The selected rows were printed correctly, even when using the Quartz theme (which doesn’t visually show the selection column). So here’s the tip: if you need reliable selection tracking, the MULTIPLE mode is much more stable.

🔍 Unfortunately, CL_SALV_TABLE doesn’t offer a way to retrieve selected columns like CL_GUI_ALV_GRID does. If you need that level of detail, it might be worth considering a migration.

Has anyone else faced this? Got workarounds to share? Let’s talk! 💬

 

Se quiser posso transformar isso num carrossel pra LinkedIn ou formatar com visuais. Só dar o toque, Felipe! 👨‍💻💡

entry.title: Leveraging SAP S/4HANA for Tank Planning and -Scheduling
entry.content:
In the complex world of supply chain and production planning, managing resources effectively becomes crucial. For businesses faced with tank constraints, such as consumer products (e.g. beverages and dairies), chemicals, oil and gas, or pharmaceuticals, tank scheduling forms an important part of their operations, and this is where SAP PP/DS comes into play. These industries often involve continuous or batch processes where storage and handling of liquids in tanks require precise scheduling and resource optimization. SAP Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling (PP/DS) is an integral part of SAP S/4HANA, which can significantly improve tank scheduling efficiency. Let's dive deeper to explore how PP/DS helps address tank scheduling challenges.

Optimized Resource Allocation
PP/DS in S/4HANA offers a detailed representation of the manufacturing process, including tank scheduling. It uses sophisticated algorithms for production planning and detailed scheduling based on real-time data, ensuring optimal resource allocation. The resources, in this case, include storage / buffer tanks, which may have different capacities, may be intended for different materials, and may be placed at different parts of the production network. SAP PP/DS takes all these factors into account while scheduling, leading to efficient utilization of resources and overall cost reduction.

Improved Inventory Management
Effective tank scheduling requires efficient inventory management. SAP PP/DS in S/4HANA provides capabilities to track tank usage, monitor inventory levels, and show future usage based on production plans. By accurately modelling the flow of materials into and out of storage tanks, PP/DS ensures that the production schedule aligns with tank availability, avoiding overflows or shortages. This not only helps in preventing stockouts but also safeguards against overstocking, which might render tanks unusable for a certain period. This is crucial for operational efficiency and maintaining safety standards.

Automated Scheduling
In the traditional system, tank scheduling is a labour-intensive and time-consuming process, prone to errors. SAP PP/DS in S/4HANA simplifies this process by automating most of the tasks linked with tank scheduling. PP/DS also supports synchronization between production scheduling and inventory levels, helping process industries balance the demands for storage capacity with the availability of production inputs and outputs. This is essential for optimizing the use of tanks, where capacity utilization must align with production and shipping schedules. This automated process ensures higher accuracy, saving time and human resources for other critical tasks.

Real-Time Monitoring and Control
One of the most impactful benefits of SAP PP/DS in S/4HANA in tank scheduling is real-time monitoring and control. With real-time data, planning can be dynamic and responsive to the ever-changing demands and situations in the supply chain. The software also alerts users about any potential issues, ensuring timely intervention and resolution.

Moreover, PP/DS integrates seamlessly with other SAP solutions, facilitating better coordination across the overall supply chain, procurement, manufacturing, and distribution. This integration ensures consistent data flow and visibility, which is crucial for managing complex storage and production requirements in process industries.

Does all this sound familiar to you?
Even for long lasting SAP customers leveraging PP/DS in its legacy solution APO since decades, it was challenging to succeed without major customizations.

What is different with PP/DS in S/4HANA?
With embedding PP/DS in S/4HANA the capabilities for constrained based production planning and scheduling have been significantly increased. Tank planning and scheduling is part of the extended planning scope. Since 2020 SAP is delivering continuously superior functionality in this space which include:

  • Improved planning algorithms for storage constraints and resource networks (since S/4HANA 2020 and ongoing)
  • Better visualization of bucketed and detailed tank levels (S/4HANA 2021)
  • New Modelling capabilities such as raw material tanks addressing the purchasing process (external procurement and stock transfers) shipped with S/4HANA 2022
  • Improved detailed scheduling algorithms (started with S/4HANA 2022 and ongoing)
  • Improved interactive scheduling including tank splits (since S/4HANA 2023)

Beyond the mentioned highlights the solution growth for tank planning is shown in the following picture. Future plans and more details on many delivered innovations are documented in the roadmap explorer (PP/DS Roadmap – extend selection for seeing past innovations).

 

Figure 1: Solution Growth for tank planning with PP/DS

 

Along with core planning and scheduling capabilities tank planning with PP/DS has also been improved for interactive planning with the FIORI-Gantt App “Advanced Scheduling Board (ASB)”. Better visualization of filling / draining activities and a tank occupation indicator were already provided with earlier shipments. The upcoming planned release S/4HANA 2025 provides an integrated fill level view in the resource chart for better monitoring of detailed filling curves. ASB will also provide a user-based configuration of shapes in various charts of the Gantt-UI.

 

Figure 2: Advanced Scheduling Board (ASB) with fill level curve for tank resources

 

In summary, SAP PP/DS brings a lot to the table for effective and efficient tank scheduling. It supports batch and continuous productions scenarios with recipes and (discrete) routings. It not only streamlines the scheduling process but also ensures optimum resource usage and improved inventory management. The capabilities offered by SAP PP/DS can significantly reduce the manual effort and errors in tank scheduling, leading to smoother operations, significant time and cost savings, and enhancing the overall productivity of manufacturing companies. Adopting such technology is a compelling way forward to stay competitive and profitable in the evolving market dynamics.

entry.title: "set tracefile" doesn't display stored proc call params
entry.content:
I had a much longer question typed up, but when I choose a "board" for where to post this, the web page cleared out my text.

For finding slow queries you can execute the calls

  • set trace <filename> for <spid_to_trace>
  • set show_sqltext on  -- applies to spid_to_trace, not the current session
  • set show_<optimizer_option>
  • set tracefile off for <spid_to_trace>  -- very important, trace will continue after current session logs off

But the "set trace" command doesn't show parameters for stored proc calls.   Anyway to trace that info?

Thanks in advance
Ben

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you’re an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Artificial Intelligence, SAP Business Technology Platform, within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor’s or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2–3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP’s mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via 👉 SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP’s social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

entry.title: Navigate the AI Era of Compliance:Join the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025
entry.content:
Why Attend?

Whether you are already using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance or are exploring ways to digitalize and future-proof your statutory reporting and electronic invoicing processes, this one-day summit offers best practices, live demos, and customer experiences – all through the lens of innovation and compliance.

This year, we will explore:

✅How artificial intelligence is transforming compliance: Discover how embedded AI and SAP’s copilot Joule are helping companies resolve electronic document errors faster and more intelligently.

✅Emerging regulations, localized response: Stay on top of expanding mandates – from e-invoicing to e-reporting – across the globe, and see how SAP helps you adapt seamlessly with pre-built country-specific capabilities.

✅A future-ready roadmap: Hear from SAP experts about what is next for SAP Document and Reporting Compliance.

✅Customer voices: Learn directly from businesses navigating regulatory challenges today – what worked, what did not work, and how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance helped them simplify operations, reduce risks, and scale with confidence.

Compliance is not optional - but complexity can be

Today’s compliance challenges go beyond just checking boxes. Governments are enforcing real-time reporting, auditing more frequently, and expecting machine-readable transparency. It is no longer about just being compliant, but about being agile.

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is built to help companies operating in multiple countries:

  • Integrate regulatory updates into processes – without disrupting operations
  • Standardize global compliance while meeting local requirements
  • Reduce manual tasks, risks, and costs with AI-driven automation

Let’s shape the future together

The SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 is more than just a product update event. It is a chance to connect with a global community, gain knowledge, and prepare your organization for whatever comes next – backed by SAP’s expertise in electronic documents processing and statutory reporting.

Whether you're a tax manager, IT lead, CFO, or localization expert – this event is for you.

Register now for free to secure your spot! We look forward to seeing you online on September 25.

 

Register now

 

Have a question? Drop it in the comments—our team is happy to help.

About the solution

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is SAP’s end-to-end solution to help businesses meet local legal requirements for electronic documents processing worldwide. It streamlines electronic invoicing, statutory reporting, and audit obligations across countries – while enabling automation, scalability, and real-time compliance with confidence.
